text: So I have an assignment in which I choose an organisation and write stuff about it in about 500 words, and include a ton of plots with data about the organisation. I chose Julia, but I'm not sure what data I could plot/ where I could get some data regarding Julia. Any suggestions?

elements.text: So I have an assignment in which I choose an organisation and write stuff about it in about 500 words, and include a ton of plots with data about the organisation. I chose Julia, but I'm not sure what data I could plot/ where I could get some data regarding Julia. Any suggestions?

attachments.title: The Julia Project and Its Entities
attachments.text: The Julia Project and Its Entities | There are a number of entities surrounding the Julia programming language. Understandably, many people are not entirely clear on what these groups are and what their relationship to each other is. It’s pretty hard to know about these things without being in the thick of it. In this blog post I’ll...

text: what I mean with that is that there's no central organization for you to look at to gather data to plot

elements.text: what I mean with that is that there's no central organization for you to look at to gather data to plot

text: I guess you could plot github stars over time?

elements.text: I guess you could plot github stars over time?

text: the really interesting stats like "how many users" or "important packages" are hard to gauge because there is very little info about that (since the community as a whole was very opposed to minimal telemetry - caused a big kerfuffle last year)

elements.text: the really interesting stats like "how many users" or "important packages" are hard to gauge because there is very little info about that (since the community as a whole was very opposed to minimal telemetry - caused a big kerfuffle last year)

text: though there may still be some info you could plot with the Pkg server statistics that do exist - I don't remember where they were available though

elements.text: though there may still be some info you could plot with the Pkg server statistics that do exist - I don't remember where they were available though

text: I could also give you access to the discourse stats that Regulars get if you’re on discourse.  It gives you the number of new users/posts/views per day over all history

text:
• I wasn't able to see the reports of Discourse. Maybe I'm not trusted enough on Discourse maybe?
• I could see the Slack stats! Cool to see the 5-2 cycle of daily activity. I'm assuming its a weekdays-weekend cycle where the weekends have lower activity
• I could also access the Zulip stats

attachments.title: Measuring the prevalence of documentation, testing and continuous integration in Julia packages
attachments.text: Documentation, testing, and continuous integration (CI) are some of the key ingredients to make software maintainable and reliable in the long term. During the first part of my (short) career in academia, when my daily software tools were C, Fortran and IDL, I barely knew these practices (probably didn’t know...
